N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1262.76 - Registration and inspection

State Regulations
(a) No
automotive vehicle or piece of mobile equipment shall be used except in areas
so designated by the airport manager, until registered, inspected and approved
by the Port Authority. (b) Every
application for registration, inspection or re-inspection shall be made upon
forms prescribed and furnished by the Port Authority, accompanied by evidence
of automotive liability insurance in the amount: Bodily injury
$1,000,000

Each person

Liability
3,000,000

Each occurrence

Property
3,000,000

Aggregate each occurrence
except as may otherwise specifically be authorized by
the manager. Such application shall also be accompanied by a detailed, authorized statement certifying compliance with the provisions of the rules and
regulations set forth in this Part. (c) Automotive vehicles and mobile equipment
shall be submitted for registration and inspection prior to their use upon the
airport and shall be submitted for reinspection once every year
thereafter. (d) Automotive vehicles
and mobile equipment approved by the Port Authority shall be furnished an
initial registration certificate to be kept on the air terminal, and an
inspection identification which shall be displayed on the vehicle in the place
or places designated by the manager of the air terminal. (e) Automotive vehicles and mobile equipment
submitted for inspection and registration shall bear the name of owner or
lessee thereon, by means of a name plate or lettering. (f) Automotive vehicles and mobile equipment
shall be inspected, if involved in an accident, prior to returning to
service. Notes
